Reviews.Title: Every home should have a DUAL sensor smoke detector
Reviews.Author: Firstinlastout
Reviews.Content: As a professsional firefighter/paramedic for nearly 13 years, I see a lot of fires. I do know that most detectors out there are NOT dual sensor....they are mostly only ionization detectors that detect flame.  Remember it's usually not the fire that will kill you, it's the smoke and it's deadly component carbon monoxide that will end your life.  Photoelectric detectors detect these smoke particles and alert you.......ionization types rarely do if it's a slow smoldering fire. If your sleeping, by the time the ionization sensors detect the actual flames, the smoke and the CO will most likely have already gotten to you and you will be dead. That's why it's so VERY VERY important to have a dual-sensor smoke detector.  This item particular item IS a dual sensor that is designed to alert you to both smoldering low-flame fires and high intensity/ rapid flame fires. This detector will protect you 100% from fire related death/injury if used properly and placed correctly in your home.  Remember to replace the battery every time you switch the clock during daylight savings time or any time the detector chirps.  Always look for  a photoelectric/ionization detector and buy one.  Have one in your hallway, in the main living room at the very least and I always like to put one in each room because I am overly cautious.  Also make sure to have a B-C extinguisher on hand near the kitchen to put out kitchen grease fires....the #1 cause of residential structure fires.  Hopefully you can put a small one out, but if you discharge the entire extinguisher and the fire is not out......evacuate the house immediately and make sure you or someone called 911 prior to exiting your home.  Stay safe !

Reviews.Title: First Alert Smoke Detector
Reviews.Author: L. Edwards
Reviews.Content: After my house filled with smoke and my 2 Kiddie smoke detectors did not alarm, I replaced them with this First Alert model. I had already installed a First Alert SA320CN in the basement when the Kiddie I had there unexpectedly fell on the floor and broke (never did figure out why.)After the Kiddie alarms failed to work, I tested the First Alert in the basement by starting a smoky fire in a metal container. The First Alert alarmed as expected.Since my experience with the Kiddie detectors, after installing them, I will test alarms in the future with actual fire & smoke. The little "test" button on the Kiddie detector always worked, but that didn't assure that it would work in an emergency.Note: the SA320CN has replaced a prior model, SA302, which has been discontinued.

Reviews.Title: Straightforward life-saver -- highly recommended
Reviews.Author: V. Black "alsbookshelf"
Reviews.Content: I purchased four of these at once to replace my four aging smoke alarms. I like these units because they are inexpensive, compact, easy to install, they have two methods of detecting fire or smoke, and they run on inexpensive, easy-to-replace AA batteries. (I have never liked 9-volt batteries.) If you need a good, well-rated unit in a stand-alone smoke & fire alarm, this is the one for you. If you need a networked unit, I believe First Alert produces such a unit, but that feature will cost you  more. The SA320CN is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Defective product, customer sevice is not very helpful
Reviews.Author: H. Shenoy
Reviews.Content: Bought from amazon in June 2012.Came with brand new Energizer batteries and installed them.Started Chirping in 1 month.Replaced with brand new Duracell batteries.Chirping in 1 month.Replaced again with brand new Duracell batteries.Chirping in 1 month.Called BRK (First Alert) customer service. They said to replace only with Energizer batteries and call back if it chirps - huh?Seems so strange. They are forcing me to buy Energizer batteries and also not willing to replace a defective product (what about the first set that came from Amazon? I told them it was Energizer, but she would not have it. Said I have to buy new ones and do it again).Nowhere is it advertised that only Energizer batteries are to be used.Very suspicious of so many positive amazon reviews.Bad product, Poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: Battery smoke detector
Reviews.Author: Allan G. Peck "Prof"
Reviews.Content: I replaced several battery operated smoke detectors with this model.  They were easy to install and are working perfectly.  I especially like the feature that will allow me to replace the batteries without removing the unit from the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: Good not great
Reviews.Author: B. Levine "recycleguy"
Reviews.Content: Have owned prior models of dual First Alert home smoke alarms,using traditional 9v battery.  Bought 1 and liked it so boughtsix more.  2 issues but otherwise seems fine.1) Battery compartment difficult to close.2) One of seven is complaining about battery loweven after changing the battery multiple times. I evenhave a multimeter and tested the batteries, and theyindicated correct voltage.  Called First Alert, and atfirst they blamed the battery saying you can only use 1 of the 2major brands you know.  I explained I have others with samebrand of battery working, and also the same unit worked finefor a long while (had it for 8 months).  My theory is that sincesummer arrived, A/C unit blew some dust into the room which got intothe unit, and now it's not functioning.  Just a guess.First Alert agreed to replace unit after I explained that I hadbought many of them and all but one worked.This is the 2nd time over the years I called them about a defectiveunit. The first time they did replace as per the lengthy warranty,which is why I bought many more of these.

Reviews.Title: It works but can't really be silenced
Reviews.Author: A. Benenson
Reviews.Content: I know it works because it began beeping when we were roasting a chicken and the kitchen started to get a little smoky.But then I found out the one thing I don't like about it - pressing the TEST/SILENCE button only silences it for maybe 10-20 seconds. So of course I had to press it 3 more times, and then I finally had had enough and took the batteries out (temporarily).Note to First Alert: The whole point of a silence button is to PREVENT people from taking out the batteries. So by making the silence last for such a short time, it's pointless. Next time you make a new smoke alarm, make the silence button last for at least a minute or two.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This Item
Reviews.Author: Techno Junkie
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews for this product.  Many were good and many were poor.  I took a chance.  Bad Idea.  This product arrived timely and it was a good price.  I installed the item with the batteries that arrived with it.  Within less than a couple of weeks it began to chirp. So I replaced the batteries.  Less than a month later it began to chirp again.  Replaced the batteries one more time and it began to chirp within a week or so.  So I called the Mfg to let them know the problem I was having and they honored the warranty on the product. They shipped me another product.  I installed it and it began to chirp within two weeks.  I called the Mfg back and and told them about the problem I was having.  They stated they would send me another unit along with a return label. This was on 1-7-13....  I am still waiting :(.......  One other thing about this.  The unit I originally recv was mfg in Sept 2012.  I had informed the Mfg of this date and had thought it might have been a bad lot number.  But the replacement unit they shipped me was also Mfg in Sept 2012.  When I called back and asked for another warranty replacement I asked them not to send me one with a Sept 2012 Mfg date....  I am still waiting :(......

Reviews.Title: Odd mounting instructions - Alarm seems good quality
Reviews.Author: Gregor
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of the First Alert SA320CN smoke and fire alarms because of the double sensor.  The mounting instructions are strange, stating to place the screws at 3 and 9 o'clock.  If you do that, then you can only screw the alarm onto the mounting bracket part way, which makes it seem loose. I would recommend mounting screws at 4 & 10 or 5 & 11, with the mounting bracket's Caution label towards the front. It makes a big difference if the Caution is at the back. There are 3 pairs of holes in the mounting bracket (one pair would have been enough), so be sure to decide on which pair you're going to use. They are close together, and it's easy to mix them up while trying to mark the drilling locations. Experiment before drilling holes. Mounting hardware included (screws and plastic anchors).  The included Energizer batteries were fresh, expiring 2017. The alarm is loud.  I haven't had any false alarms, but I haven't burned anything either. I like the 10 year warranty.  The battery drawer is nice in theory, but is not very easy to use when the alarm is mounted on the ceiling.  It's easier to take the alarm down to change batteries. The device seems sturdy.  I'm happy with them. Purchased Dec. 10, 2011.

Reviews.Title: Good Alarm but incorrect product information.
Reviews.Author: NY Psychotherapist
Reviews.Content: I bought 14 of these for our home mainly because there appeared to be a feature that allowed the user to mute the alarm using a tv remote. Nope, not true. Just got off the phone with First Alert, agent states this feature was discontinued. So, if this is an important feature to you, BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: smoke alarm
Reviews.Author: Brenda M. Urban
Reviews.Content: Easy to install, easy to change batteries, and comes with two AA batteries. Highly recommended by Consumer Reports magazine. Detects two kinds of fire in house. Great alarm.

Reviews.Title: False alarms
Reviews.Author: R. Owen "rowen"
Reviews.Content: Alarm just alerts for no reason. I can't recommend this product. Not sure it's worth the time and effort to return for a new one.

Reviews.Title: I've had 2. Each lasted about 2 months.
Reviews.Author: The Reader
Reviews.Content: I've had 2 of these units.  Both of them have had to be replaced within about 2 months of receiving.  The first one would just chirp endlessly and was replaced under warranty.  The second one would chirp 3 times really fast every minute. It was also replaced under warranty.

Reviews.Title: SA320 Does NOT Have TV Remote Silence Feature
Reviews.Author: William Baker
Reviews.Content: Two First Alert SA320 units(SA320CN - same)received today. Amazon performance extraordinary, as usual. Units were ordered Saturday and received Monday. Thanks Amazon!The First Alert SA302 has a feature to silence the alarm using a TV remote control unit. Several of these units are used in our high ceilings and the ability to silence the horn with the TV remote is useful.The product description for the SA320 on the Amazon site lists the TV remote silence as a feature. Unfortunately, this is not the case. The First Alert manual enclosed with the product makes no mention of the TV remote feature. First Alert Customer Affairs advised that the TV remote feature was never in the SA320 unit. Further, he advised that First Alert does not now offer a smoke alarm with that feature. He did say that a combination CO/Smoke unit does still have the TV remote feature.I'm disappointed that the TV remote feature is no longer available. I am keeping the units and giving them a 5 star rate based on experience with other First Alert smoke alarms. Hopefully Amazon will revise the sales literature to remove the TV remote feature.

Reviews.Title: The Best Smoke Detector in the World
Reviews.Author: Gene P. Louie
Reviews.Content: This model has an abundance of professional and consumer awards..1. Consumersearch.com award said that it was the "Top Rated - Best Around Smoke Detector.".2. Choice Magazine tested it as the best of 15 models..3. Consumer Magazine rated the device first place among the 18 tested..4. It was Consumer Reports' choice for a dual-sensor alarm..5. U.S.A. Today highly recommended it to its readers..You can not argue with success.

Reviews.Title: Defective on Arrival
Reviews.Author: sseverus
Reviews.Content: This First Alert smoke alarm was defective on arrival. After battery install (Yes, it was done correctly) there was no sign of life. No blinking green light to indicate it was working properly. Pressing the 'Test' button produced nothing but silence. Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: No LED light
Reviews.Author: Sparr Heights Mom
Reviews.Content: The LED light was supposed to come on green if working and red blinking for something else.  The LED light never worked.  So I didn't trust the product.

Reviews.Title: Inconvenient
Reviews.Author: Kermit
Reviews.Content: The unit seems to be sturdily built, especially when compared to other units I have possessed.  I like the fact that the mounting flange and sensor unit are separate pieces.  With my old detector the mounting flange was flimsy and had to be removed from the wall, along with the attached detector, in order to change batteries.The unit is always displayed in promotions with the sensor grill in the 6 o/c position.  I prefer to mount it with the test button in the 6 o/c position in order to facilitate reaching it above a doorway.  I would have thought I would get such a configuration with the screws inserted at the 6 o/c and 12 o/c positions in the wall.  But it doesn't work that way.  Of course, you could always rotate the unit fully clockwise until fully seated and then back it off CCW until it is positioned the way you want it.  But then it would not be very secure and may be close to coming apart.  I have found a way to position the unit so the button is at the 6 o/c position and it is also securely positioned by rotating it fully CW.  A little inconvenient, though.I get three beeps from the unit when I depress the test button, as advertised.  But a  light does not blink every minute, as referenced in the instructions.  When I mentioned this to Customer Service they didn't seem particularly concerned about it.The instructions are impossible to read.  The text is much too small. I was not able to produce suitable copies with my scanner/ printer.  Customer Service suggested I press the CTRL button on my PC while rotating the wheel on my mouse to enlarge the font.  I used another method by utilizing the Enlarge feature on the PDF file.  Then I was able to crop the individual pages by using the MS Snipping Tool on my PC and printing the result. You'd think the company could splurge a little by printing the manual on 2 or 3 pages so everyone could read it.  More inconvenienceI understand there is some confusion regarding the battery situation.  I received Duracell batteries with my detector and the same batteries were recommended in the manual.  There was no reference to Energizer batteries anywhere.  There is no periodic chirping.So I have no blinking light and no periodic chirping.  The unit just sits on the wall like a painting.  How am I to know if it will work better than a painting under emergency situations?Well, before I contacted Customer Service and before I was able to decipher the instructions, I held a charcoal lighter up to the unit (don't try this at home).  No response. I was later informed by Customer Service that this action could render the unit inoperative.  A fire and smoke detector that does recognize a flame. Hmmmm!I later placed a burning, crumpled piece of paper in a bowl and held in up to the detector (don't try this at home either).  I blew out the fire so the smoke would envelope the detector.  After about 1 minute the alarm finally activated.  But the smoke was only a few inches from the detector.  Now I'm wondering just how sensitive this thing is to smoke. So I appear to have a fire and smoke detector that does not respond to fire and marginally responds to smoke if present a few inches away.  How can I be assured that the unit will sound off should it encounter a real emergency situation?  Faith?  I'm not sure that will cut it.  Do I have to burn my house down (don't try this at home either) to conduct a valid test of the system?  Or perhaps I should just burn the detector and listen for a beep before it turns to ashes.I would like to hear more reviews of the product in action (or inaction) during actual emergency situations.  In the meantime I will not deduct rating stars for performance since I have no evidence on how it will work under real fires.  I am deducting one star, however, for the practically useless manual and for the mounting experience listed (above).

Reviews.Title: Good design at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Macman
Reviews.Content: We have a dog that panics at the mere sound of the "chirps"  that smoke alarms give off when the battery is low, so the last thing that I need is a smoke alarm that goes off for no good reason. After reading a lot of reviews I finally chose this one. I needed to replace all of our 20-year-old units, so I purchased one to try out for a week. After no false alarms and seeing the intelligent construction of the unit, I purchased 3 more. After several months of use there have been no problems of any kind. A couple of things that I like: With a simple twist you can take the unit off of its base for easy battery replacement or cleaning. And the batteries themselves are in a pop-out drawer and are easy to replace. As for loudness, I don't understand the reviews which complained that they weren't loud enough. I think they're plenty loud - a very nasty, attention-getting sound and level. If I needed another smoke alarm I'd purchase another of these in a heartbeat. The only thing that I can't comment on is how well they would work in a true emergency situation. I guess you've just got to trust the manufacturer for that.

Reviews.Title: Works great!!!
Reviews.Author: G. Golden
Reviews.Content: I bought three of these to replace older models that had reached the end of their useful life. I like the fact that they're dual sensor alarms (one for fast flaming fires, and one for slow smoldering fires), and that they take AA batteries instead of 9volt batteries. Installation was very easy!! You mount the base and then just twist on the alarm, couldn't be easier! The batteries (included) go in a little drawer that slides out and are super easy to change, just press down from above the batteries while the drawer is open and they pop right out. There's also an easy to see diagram that show you which direction to put the new batteries in. The twist mount makes it easy to remove the alarm for cleaning (much easier than trying to stand on a ladder with a vacuum cleaner) or changing the batteries if your not comfortable changing them while its mounted to the ceiling. I haven't had a fire, but these alarms went off right away when something in my oven overflowed and started smoking, and the silence feature worked when I pushed it with a broom handle (instructions say it will silence the alarm for 15 minutes). Kept it quiet until I could get the smoke cleared out. I am very happy with these and have already recommended them to my family, friends, and neighbors.

Reviews.Title: 1st one falsed often, 2nd one seems great
Reviews.Author: J. Wagner
Reviews.Content: The first one was bad and I wrote the review below.  But they sent me a new one and it hasn't falsed once in about 2 months.  I guess it was just a defective detector.  They honored the warranty admirably, so I've changed the rating to 4 stars.Original review said:It likes to alarm in the middle of the night for no reason. Alarms don't follow any of the patterns in the manual, it just beeps for 20 seconds or so, wakes everybody up, then stops. This one's going in the dumpster.

Reviews.Title: Highly rated - easy to install First Alert SA320CN
Reviews.Author: LARRY REED
Reviews.Content: Item rated highest by consumer reports. Purchased eleven of these to install/replace old smoke alarms in various locations in my 3-level home. Amazon price was very good. Easy to install. Uses AA batteries (came with item), a plus for me. No more proprietary or 9V batteries.

Reviews.Title: blinks a green light frequently
Reviews.Author: Arctic lady
Reviews.Content: I bought because it was highly rated and a reliable company. It was hard to get used to a blinking green light at night in the bedroom but wefinally did.  That's my only complaint.  I suppose its meant to show its working.

Reviews.Title: Kept going off!
Reviews.Author: J. Cornelius
Reviews.Content: So we bought this for our house. Worked great until we had a little stove mishap (no fire, but alarm went off appropriately). However, after that the this unit just would not calm down! At random times it would go off day and night. Battery change did not help. At first we were worried maybe there was a fire issue and we were missing it - we checked - none of the other smoke/CO alarms would go off at the same time, even if we moved others into the same room. Finally when it went off at 2 AM we had enough. Time to buy a different one.

Reviews.Title: This sensor saved my life today
Reviews.Author: DD
Reviews.Content: My senile mother in law who lives with us was boiling something on the stove right before she went to bed - something we told her not to do. Of course, she forgot to turn it off and left it boiling all night. Around 2 pm, this alarm alerted making loud beeping sounds bc of the smoke from the empty pot that was still boiling on the stove!I have 2 kids and literally installed this like 2 weeks ago. If I hadn't, we'd all be dead or at least the young ones would have suffered from smoke inhalation.Now the device comes with duracel batteries and not enegizer ones as I saw on some of the reviews. Also, hard for someone like my mother in law to try and remove the batteries to tamper with it since she is always burning incense at home.I'm ordering 2 more today.

Reviews.Title: Recent Purchase
Reviews.Author: makinboots
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased two of the SA320CN First Alert Smoke and Fire Alarms.  I was replacing my old ionization smoke alarms that had recently stopped working and decided to go with the double sensor.  I had recently watched a public safety segment on our local news for fire prevention month and made the decision to go with the double sensor.  Installation was not a problem for either of these and will continue to replace older ones. I did not give the product a five star rating as I had to purchase new batteries for one of the detectors as the ones that came with it were already dead.

Reviews.Title: Alarm went off at random times
Reviews.Author: T. Mayer
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer said this alarm went off once because of something burning in the kitchen (just some chicken tenders in the toaster oven), but then after being silenced, would go of randomly hours and days later. I kept thinking there was smoke in the house and opening all the doors, but when it happened at 5am I had enough. Ended up ordering another product.

Reviews.Title: Reasonably satisfied
Reviews.Author: Phillip Dobbe
Reviews.Content: Bought two of them. One worked and one didn't. Tried everything, including new batteries. CS for First Alert was closed due to holidays. Finally found out the 3-chirp every 5 minutes meant "malfunction", too bad that code wasn't on their info. Amazon of course was great with the return. Second time, everything is fine and feel better knowing I'm protected.

Reviews.Title: Good product but advertised size dimensions wrong
Reviews.Author: BigD
Reviews.Content: Just received a bunch of these to replace another brand in my home. The actual size of the product is not what's shown on the Amazon description.  The actual size is 5 inches diameter on the dot and the height just about 2 inches.Oddly, the product page has two sets of sizes, and they're both wrong. The "product specification" section says Height:9.06 inches; Length:7.31 inches; Width:7.75 inches (all of these are waaaay off). In the "product description" it says the unit measures 5.7x5.7x2.8 inches.  Closer, but still wrong.Reason why it's a big deal to me... my previous alarms were 5.5 inches wide. When I remove them, the paint which was underneath the old base will be slightly brighter in color than the rest of the ceiling (since it was screwed on there for many years). I was happy to think the advertised larger 5.7 inches of the new alarm would cover this up so no one would see a "ring" of color difference. But now that I see it's really 5 inches wide a ring will be visible.  Amazon, please correct the specs!Aside from the size issue, the units came at a great price. The batteries are inserted through a small compartment door which slides open on the side of the units. It takes a tiny bit of force to pull it open but nothing excessive.  A neat little feature which is not mentioned in the product description is that it comes with little locking pins (if you choose to use them) for the battery compartment door and base mount. These prevent the door and unit from being manually opened/unscrewed without the use of a screwdriver (to depress the pins). For my one family home, I don't need to use these pins.  The instructions say these are meant as a removal deterence if the alarms are used in a public area (or any area where you don't want someone to easily unscrew the unit or swipe the batteries).

Reviews.Title: Less then 1 year and 2 of the 5 have malfunctioned
Reviews.Author: starchild
Reviews.Content: We purchased 5 of these last year, loved the idea of having a dual fire alarm in my home. It's been about 10 months since we installed them and 2 of them have already malfunctioned. Doesn't make me feel safe about the others still installed, now i will have to shell out more money to replace them all with a different brand fire alarm. DON'T BUY.

Reviews.Title: Reduced sensitivity?  Er...noooo
Reviews.Author: C. Clark
Reviews.Content: This is just as sensitive, maybe more, than the one I replaced....so I'm not real happy.  This is mounted on the ceiling near the back door in the kitchen.  It's about as far away from the oven, etc as it could be.  We cannot get gas to our home so only cook with electricity....and always use the hood fan.  Very little smoke is ever generated, yet this alarm goes off at the slightest hint.  I ordered this based on the item's description.  That description is misleading at minimum.

Reviews.Title: safety x2
Reviews.Author: BXC
Reviews.Content: it has dual sensors which is good but i had to stick a standard alarm in the hallway where i had this one because steam from the shower (you couldn't even see it) was setting it off. it's upstairs in the nursery now.

Reviews.Title: BEEPS INTERMITTENTLY!
Reviews.Author: Living the Life
Reviews.Content: Wished we had bothered to read the bad reviews on this thing! USELESS! Not worth the money to send it back. Beeps in the morning for several hours. Checked battery, checked battery orientation. Changed out for brand new battery. Checked EVERYTHING. Beeps intermittently for several hours and then shuts up.NEVER BUY FROM THESE GUYS! Seriously. It's a WASTE of MONEY!

Reviews.Title: Very easy to install
Reviews.Author: 4iab2001
Reviews.Content: I like that I got a trusted brand name at a good price.  The dual sensors are the only way to go.  I certainly feel safer with that feature. The installation was very easy for someone not very handy.  The battery light indicator blinks every minute.  It is inconspicuous and that led to some criticisms in other reviews.  Frankly, I like the less obtrusive nature of the indicator.

Reviews.Title: Not sure this works the way it's supposed ti
Reviews.Author: Adrienne Baxter
Reviews.Content: I bought this after seeing a news story about the importance of having a dual-sensor smoke/fire detector. One night, I accidentally fell asleep after putting a frozen pizza in the oven. When I woke up 2-3 HOURS later,  the smell of smoke was very strong & burned my eyes although there was no visible smoke or fire. The pizza was charred black but this detector never went off.

Reviews.Title: Hard to Test
Reviews.Author: History Buff
Reviews.Content: The test button on these alarms are very hard to push.  One alarm, in particular, took a lot of force before the test alarm would sound.  And that was while holding it.  When it is on the ceiling, one will have trouble.  I called the company and they said it was probably "tight".  I can only hope that it will sound the alarm in an emergency.  There was no offer to exchange the alarm.

Reviews.Title: No Brainer
Reviews.Author: Consumerette
Reviews.Content: I wasn't aware that there was such a thing as dual sensor smoke alarms until I started looking around on the internet to replace some older units I had. After some research I found the dual sensor SA320CN. I bought 7 to replace all the smoke alarms in the house. I chose First Alert because of their reputation and long history of manufacturing smoke alarms. Also because of some less than favorable reviews of competitors products. Yeah I could of bought less expensive alarms but some things you just don't skimp on. I received them in a couple days and installed them the next day. I tested them with a UL listed aerosol spray that doesn't leave a reside and is made for testing smoke alarms. They all function perfectly so far. I take the job of protecting my family seriously and if I'm aware of the latest and greatest technology, then I'm going to put it to use.

Reviews.Title: 2 out of 4 no longer work
Reviews.Author: A. M. Black "Andy B"
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 of these after watching a TV rpt about the dangers of having only one sensor type.All installed the same day using the batteries supplied. After replacing all batteries annually for 3 years without issue, two of the four have begun to create false alarms, and are useless. I have replaced batteries with freshly bought, long-dated stock - even though the "bad" ones showed "good" on my battery tester. None have been abused, dropped or painted. The instructions say "wipe with a damp cloth -  do not vaccuum"; and "if the alarm continues to give false alarms it should be disposed of properly and replaced" (paraphrasing). SO the 10 year warranty doesn't mean anything - these two have lasted less than 5 years.I'm buying a different brand now.

Reviews.Title: It works, but!
Reviews.Author: Stwpapa
Reviews.Content: I'm an elderly person who can't hear very well. I can barely hear this Fire alarm when I'm awake, not at all when asleep. Not a repeat purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice dual-detection smoke detector
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I recently noticed that all 7 of the smoke detectors in my house were more than 10 years old. So I bought a 7 pack of these guys and have so far been very happy with them.They use AA batteries - NO MORE 9V!! So I can use rechargeables with them (although they came with two duracells already so I won't need to replace them for a while)Replacement of my older detectors was very simple. The plate that attaches to the ceiling is designed to fit multiple hole-widths so in almost every case all I had to do was loosen the screws from the old plate, remove and replace, and then retighten the existing screws. There was only one oddball smoke detector that was different from all the others where I needed to drill a new hole to replace it.Putting the detector into the plate is simple and can be done easily with one hand. It isn't at all hard to line it up and secure it. This is a tremendous advantage over my old detectors where you could never really tell if you were lined up properly and I would often have to fight it for a long time to get it attached correctly.The sound is nice and loud and will definitely get my attention when/if they go off. I haven't had a chance to use it, but the mute switch could be a nice feature to have if our cooking ever sets one off.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: Guntherman
Reviews.Content: I already managed to set one off when cooking in the kitchen. I didn't have the range hood turned on when making eggs and wasn't paying attention to how smokey the room was getting, and the alarm did its job. The last smoke alarms we had were old ionization type and didn't go off at all when our crock pot malfunctioned and overheated, filling our kitchen with venison steam/smoke.Easy install, clear instructions, uses AA batteries so not as expensive as 9-volts. We'll see how long they last!

Reviews.Title: Great smoke alarm
Reviews.Author: C Ordini
Reviews.Content: It does NOT go off when you burn toast!!!!  The alarm has sensors in it that detect a true fire from the smoke that does come with burnt toast or lighting a candle.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Keep Your Home Safe
Reviews.Author: prisrob "pris,"
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews before choosing this smoke detector. Almost all positives in every venue.I am a woman of a certain age who lives alone, now. I need a safe and secure system, and one that is easy to access and easy to change batteries. The battery came well packaged, easy to remove from box. A real plus is that the two AA batteries were included. I try to keep a supply of batteries, but I do run out at times. This particular smoke and fire alarm is a dual sensor, meaning it can detect smoke/fire in two different methods, which gives me a greater level of security. A fire/smoke detector unit like this are a big plus in establishing trust and a feeling of security. I like the fact that it uses AA batteries and is very easy to install. My smoke/fire alarm was old, still worked, but I did not trust it.  The newer models are much more efficient than older ones.I was able to install this high on my wall near the ceiling and used Monkey Glue as suggested by the first reviewer here on Amazon. You do not need to take the entire alarm down to change the batteries, another big deal for me. I was not aware that I needed an alarm for every level of my home, so have ordered more.Recommended.  prisrob 11-01-13

Reviews.Title: Easy to install ... easy to replace batteries
Reviews.Author: TulipFever "Jan"
Reviews.Content: I really like the way the unit can be taken down quickly by unscrewing it from the mount.  I haven't had any problems with the batteries.

Reviews.Title: Easy and works great
Reviews.Author: michelle ethridge
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a replacement for an old alarm.  This one was easy to install.  Weekly tests are a breeze.  Recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Very Audible - Easy to Install
Reviews.Author: Technomed
Reviews.Content: I used this to replace 5 units by other manufacturers. The dual-sensing feature is a must. Best of all is the clever "universal" mounting-hole arrangement. This lets me easily fit the alarm unit onto a variety of differently configured electrical utility boxes. And the alarm beep can be heard many rooms away.

Reviews.Title: Less false alarms
Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: Replaced a unit near the kitchen that would go off from cooking constantly. I did a side by side test and this one passed the bacon test when the other failed!

Reviews.Title: bad buy
Reviews.Author: Wugi
Reviews.Content: Batteries last about one month.  I have tried every battery manufacture there is...same result.  I have noticed the other reviews and other people are having the same problem.  It's going to the trash can.

Reviews.Title: Defective alarm on first try
Reviews.Author: Yet another tech guy
Reviews.Content: While I'd seen some of the defective unit reviews, I went ahead and ordered, as this is one of the few battery powered dual sensor models.  After a day and around noon for three days after, I got the dreaded "three chirps."  I called First Alert support and they identified this as the malfunction signal and said to return it to Amazon.  I'll update when I get a replacement.*** Update *** The new alarm arrived and has been fine. Points to Amazon for quick service, not so much for First Alert. Bumping to three stars.

Reviews.Title: So far so good; minus one star for one false alarm.
Reviews.Author: Mathieu J. Champagne
Reviews.Content: A few months ago the neighboring apartment was lit on fire by a crazy ex-tenant and my girlfriend and I woke up at 4am to the smell of smoke and a faint beeping in the distance.  Our entire hardwired smoke alarm had failed, but thanks to my light sleeping girlfriend we were able to make it out right before the firemen arrived to put the blaze out.  We lost quite a lot of our furniture and electronics in the basement to smoke damage.  Before replacing anything, I decided to purchase our own battery operated smoke detector.After some quick research I decided to go with this model, mainly because it has the double sensor...I'll risk a false alarm in order to better be prepared if any fires ever break out again.  I was hesitant at first since so many people mentioned this alarm going off at random times.  I can say that in the few months I have owned this smoke alarm it has had only 1 false alarm.  I decided to deduct a star for this, and I hope it does not happen again.  I can still recommend this product, and hopefully I never have to hear it again.

Reviews.Title: Blinking light doesn't work-
Reviews.Author: Amazon Lady
Reviews.Content: I just received it, and put it up.  I tested it, and the alarm does sound, but the red light is supposed to flash once per minute-  I guess it's not working, because it's not flashing.  The flashing light is important, because it let's you know that it's working properly.  It came with Duracell batteries, that say Dec. 2022.  So, it should work, but it doesn't.Amazon is sending me a new one, and I will update my review then.I am also going to call First Alert myself- to let them know about the problem- Quality Control?

Reviews.Title: First Alert Fire and Smoke Alarm
Reviews.Author: Edna Ferber "Pat"
Reviews.Content: I put 4 of them throughout  the house- bottom of basement stairs, kitchen, front foyer at bottom of stairs, upstairs hallway near bedrms.  All tested fine.  The alarms are REALLY LOUD.  That's a good thing!  I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: It's really quick and WORKS!
Reviews.Author: DMT
Reviews.Content: Never had the occasion to see if smoke detectors work but my element went on my coffee pot and when the alarm went off (LOUD) I ran to the kitchen and just a small amount of smoke was coming out the back of my coffee maker. I unplugged the coffee pot and took outside. So glad the smoke detector rang out because I wasn't in the kitchen. Take it from me it really works!

Reviews.Title: 3 of 4 worked out of the box
Reviews.Author: Gem Stone-Logan
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 of these smoke detectors to put in our bedrooms.  They came yesterday with batteries and 3 seemed to work fine.  However, as soon as I put the batteries in the 4th, it started chirping 3 chips approximately every 2 minutes.  I double checked the batteries were in properly and the door was secured.  I also switched the batteries with one of the other smoke detectors that wasn't having problems.  Nothing worked.  The working smoke detectors had no problems with the batteries that came with the malfunctioning one.  I've requested a replacement from Amazon with the hope that the next one works properly.As an aside, the battery compartment says to only use Energizer batteries.  However, the batteries that come with the product are Duracell brand.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Smoke Alarms
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M Spindle
Reviews.Content: I found these very easy to install and the price was great.I know they work very well because one went off the dayafter I installed it, A candle dripped into a waste basket andand the smoke in the room set off the alarm right away evenbefore I knew there was a problem..

Reviews.Title: Good Customer Service
Reviews.Author: T. M. Smith
Reviews.Content: Well, I would rate this product and the follow-up service required in my case 5 stars, but that said that I love it, and there's not much I really love, but this product and the company I do like. A lot.The first unit I received did not work, so I called First Alert, did the spot-checks to the unit that was recommended, and then was promptly sent a replacement when those tests didn't work. The replacement unit is now working as expected, even after having tested its sensitivity with a wood-burning fire about 15 feet away from the unit. Its little green light is flashing every minute to show that it's working to secure my residence from smoke and fire. (So, maybe I actually could come to love it after all.)..just my $0.02 worth. Your mileage may vary.  ~~@v@~~

Reviews.Title: a photo and ion smoke detector.
Reviews.Author: jwa
Reviews.Content: the product has both the photo and ion dector- the best como avsilable. If the product were interconected where if one alarm were activated the other(s) would also activate then the product would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: Looks good
Reviews.Author: Sujit Kumar Mahapatra "Sujit"
Reviews.Content: I received this yesterday. The test alarm works fine and produces enough sound to alert. The look of this is not bad either. I though if they could provide a blinking light, that would have helps us assure that it is working. Otherwise hard to tell if it is really working or not.

Reviews.Title: Buy Something Else
Reviews.Author: L. Zipeto
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this Mexican-made junk lasted only 2 months. Considering the price, one would think it would lastlonger than, say, the $7 models. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: They look to be high quality.
Reviews.Author: Bad Grandpa
Reviews.Content: It is impossible to rate a fire/smoke alarm accurately unless you are unfortunate enough to have your house catch fire. That said this product looks to be well designed and they are very easy to set up and mount. I did a lot of research before I bought them and the pros all said they worked very well. I hope I never find out. They were shipped quickly and without any problems.

Reviews.Title: 2nd one works
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: First one was chirping the low battery warning almost right away. I tried new batteries and those didn't help. So I contacted Amazon and they sent me a replacement right away. I just installed it and haven't heard and low battery noises yet. I'll see how long these last. I give 4 starts because the first one was bad and that tells me their quality control is slipping.

Reviews.Title: easy to install and operate
Reviews.Author: C. Winkler "Free Spirit"
Reviews.Content: Had 2 units installed in less than 10 minutes (including getting out the drill and other tools). Didn't have to use the supplied anchors since they were mounting on a wood headliner on my boat. Like the fact that they use AA batteries. Looks like the batteries will be very easy to change. Also like the flashing light to indicate the unit is working. Hopefully I won't find out how well the sensors work :)

Reviews.Title: Just enough
Reviews.Author: Tina F.
Reviews.Content: I bought two - one for each critical doorway.  The kitchen has the stove, and the family room has the fireplace.  Already had to reset the one in the kitchen.  The sensitivity in both units is just enough.

Reviews.Title: POS - It stopped working after a few months.
Reviews.Author: Yos
Reviews.Content: It looks nice, but stopped working after a few months.When it worked, did it do its job?-  I don know.

Reviews.Title: Good choice on a smoke detector
Reviews.Author: Terrell W. Stephens
Reviews.Content: After a conversation with a friend in the firefighting business, I decided to replace all of the units in my house and add a couple as well.  He recommended these.  So far they work as expected.  My inadvertently tested one of the units while cooking.

Reviews.Title: Got one dud...make sure to check it!
Reviews.Author: pcpeggs
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 of these...one of them did not function.  The alarm (beeping part) was broken.  Make sure to check before installing.

Reviews.Title: Product was defective
Reviews.Author: Robert Harkness
Reviews.Content: Ordered 2, one was OK, other was defective (could barely hear alarm).  Would have returned but not able to install until after return date so did not know it was defective until it was too late.

Reviews.Title: no false alarms when cooking
Reviews.Author: grndamgt4
Reviews.Content: I have a cathedral ceiling and my existing smoke alarms are hard wired together so every few times I cook ( and I cook a lot ) the smoke collects in the top of ceiling and it sounds like fire engines are driving from room to room terrorizing my poor dogs. Toast, blackened chicken, browning pork loin, cajun red potatoes, even making pizza all set off my existing smoke detector.I purchased the SA320CN at target for $19 which was the only local store that had it in stock.I went home, installed it, put on a pot of oil and left it till smoke was filling the kitchen, then threw in 4 small pieces of steak from last nights dinner, the entire room filled with smoke in a few seconds. Not one alarm went off and I was happy.However, my lady now wants me to take it down and test it with actual fire this weekend to be sure it works.If I have any problems I'll update this review.p.s. I plan to try out a second one in the garage/shop as the same thing happens when I'm doing a lot of sanding.

Reviews.Title: Substantially improved over earlier models
Reviews.Author: C. Winton "cwinton"
Reviews.Content: I have 4 dual sensor smoke alarms distributed at strategic locations around my house, all of which I replaced with these.  The ones I had were from First Alert and GE, all of them over 20 years old.  Well, one died so a replacement was needed.  After installing one of these, I decided to replace all 4 with this model, simply because installation and maintenance is so much easier than it used to be.  There is now only a single button for testing, the unit uses 2 AA cells instead of 9 Volt, the batteries fit into a slide out tray, and the button will silence a false alarm.  Moreover, the mounting bracket makes putting the unit up and taking it down simplicity itself, a huge improvement over my old units.  This unit deserves a 5-start rating for all of these reasons.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install, double sensor brings peace of mind
Reviews.Author: foofurrah
Reviews.Content: I settled on these alarms after a long search through the confusing world of smoke alarms and carbon monoxide detectors. I really liked the idea of having interconnected alarms, and the new "Onelink" system is pretty nifty. However, smoke alarms have a 10 year lifetime max and carbon monoxide detectors last 7 years max, and First Alert doesn't appear to make a double sensor alarm with onelink (someone correct me if I'm wrong). First Alert does make a dual photoelectric smoke and carbon monoxide detector with onelink that sells for $55 for a two pack. However, I just couldn't stomach paying $55 for something I'm going to have to replace in 7 years, and that doesn't include an ionization detector. So, for now I settled on purchasing these alarms along with separate plug-in carbon monoxide detectors (I like the Kidde's that plug in with battery backup), none of which interconnects, but which cost me $28 each for the smoke alarms which are good for 10 years each, and $25 each for the carbon monoxide detectors (there are cheaper battery-only options available) which are good for 7 years each, and am now set for the forseeable future. I'm hoping there will continue to be innovation in this field that will make devices more interconnected and less expensive before my next upgrade, so there will be fewer either/or choices to make.On this smoke alarm, it looks great, was very easy to install, and comes with clear directions and batteries. The mounting bracket includes a number of different screw slot positions, so there's an excellent chance you can fit it onto the old screws if you're replacing a different smoke alarm. Otherwise screws and drywall anchors are included. Can't comment on the battery life or false alarms yet, but I'm very satisfied and happy to know that I have both sensor types working for me. If i had to make one complaint, it would be that the plastic packaging of the alarm is kind of a pain to open, Amazon should look into adding this product to their "frustration free" packaging program.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Kiem Trong Nguyen
Reviews.Content: After using several months, I confirm it works very well. I already convince some friends and relatives to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Very nice & cost effective!
Reviews.Author: TEAMreconTX
Reviews.Content: One of the most well built smoke alarms I have ever seen & it uses AA batteries. Nice, very nice

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: Mirella
Reviews.Content: I bought this Double Sensor Battery-Powered Smoke and Fire Alarm because of the price and I love it...It's easy to place in Dining Room or any room in the house. it works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: No more false alarms
Reviews.Author: Lance C.
Reviews.Content: Installed outside our kitchen, replacing the old alarm that would go off whenever we opened the oven door. This alarm is much better and doesn't false alarm.

Reviews.Title: Good Idea
Reviews.Author: Dale the builder
Reviews.Content: I needed to upgrade my main floor smoke alarm and found this one. Using two different types of smoke sensors makes sense to me. why not do the best possible detection?  And batteries come with it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent protection and good price
Reviews.Author: Joe C.
Reviews.Content: Double sensor for both types of fire/smoke alarms. Too bad no one makes a triple alarm, with Co2, it will sell out in minutes when technology catches up. Until then, this is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Good smoke alarm
Reviews.Author: puppet master
Reviews.Content: I never knew before ordering these first alerts that you needed to have a double sensor for different types of fires, I figured an alarm is an alarm. But glad I know now. Easy install and easy to check the batteries are still working.

Reviews.Title: 10-yr batteries
Reviews.Author: kevnye
Reviews.Content: I appreciate that the "batteries included" have a 10 year rated life; the same as the alarm itself.  The product description does not mention that.  Hopefully that means I won't need to replace the batteries until I also need to replace the alarm.

Reviews.Title: Not loud enough
Reviews.Author: trout slayer
Reviews.Content: Purchase one a few days ago before ChristmasWould of like it if it was a tad bit louder. Instead i`ll have to buy 3-4 more to make it even safe in My houseI should of went to home depot to test them and hear them than have to buy online.

Reviews.Title: Just ordered 6 more! Peace of mind!
Reviews.Author: Erica Dorsey
Reviews.Content: Just oredred six more. They test out just fine and have simple installation. I have never had a false alarm but then again I have never had an alarm at all. Hope it stays that way and I never need them but I feel confident that they will save our lives in the event we do!

Reviews.Title: Basic - good price
Reviews.Author: TZS
Reviews.Content: Replace 10 year old units with this little gem - works great and has less false alarms from cooking - when located near kitchen.

Reviews.Title: Definitely Senses Smoke
Reviews.Author: Mushuk
Reviews.Content: This smoke/fire alarm has been quite effective so far. It goes off every time my husband takes one of his legendary hot showers. :) Hopefully we'll never require it's services.

Reviews.Title: Tricked by steam
Reviews.Author: Zachary Cardoza
Reviews.Content: I placed one in the hall opposite a bathroom and the alarm goes off every time someone steps out of the bathroom after a shower.

Reviews.Title: Fire Alarm
Reviews.Author: Kimberly J. Reed "Kim"
Reviews.Content: My husband purchased it...and he usually researches products with a fine tooth comb. It is installed and works great. Arrived quickly.

Reviews.Title: First Alert SA320CN Double Sensor Battery-Powered Smoke and Fire Alarm
Reviews.Author: E. Colaluca
Reviews.Content: The First Alert SA320CN Double Sensor Smoke and Fire Alarm arrived it was easy to put up. I have co combo smoke alarms in all the bedrooms so I wanted to have a Double Sensor Smoke and Fire Alarm  to cover me for both types of fires also

Reviews.Title: Easy to Install!
Reviews.Author: B. Honeycutt
Reviews.Content: I just feel safer having fires in my fireplaces that should something happen my family would be warned.  I have others but this cover s both fire and smoke.

Reviews.Title: Uses AA batteries; found it hard to spot the blinking LED
Reviews.Author: The Engineer Critic
Reviews.Content: Pro's:*  Has dual sensor (ionization & photoelectric) for detecting either flaming or smoldering fires.*  Uses 2 AA batteries (this is a "pro" because they're a little cheaper than 9V), but I don't know if battery life is affected.*  Easily detaches from ceiling for battery replacement.Con's:*  Protrudes from the ceiling further than some older models (about 2.1").*  I found the periodically blinking LED (to tell that the battery is charged) more difficult to spot on this model; look for a very quick green blink every 45 seconds.

Reviews.Title: Can save your life
Reviews.Author: Stephen M. Charme
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son and daughter to use in their apartments. So far these units are working fine. I specifically bought double sensor because I have read too many tragic stories where someone had smoke detectors, but they didn't go off because the smoke from the type of fire (slow burning versus fast burning) didn't trigger the type of smoke detector that was installed. You can read about this yourself, but the bottom line is that having a smoke detector that is both photoelectric and ionization can save your life.I bought one for each bedroom, the living room and hallway. This is not the time to skimp.Since these do not have a carbon monoxide detector built in, I also bought the Kidde Nighthawk carbon monoxide detector. I have used those for years in my own house to supplement the professionally installed detectors I have from ADT.Bottom line: Double sensor is important, and First Alert has proved reliable for me. Make sure you also buy a carbon monoxide detector and fire extinguisher.

Reviews.Title: much better than other detectors
Reviews.Author: PC Mountain
Reviews.Content: I replaced my old ionization type smoke detectors with this one and it works much better. The ionization type detectors wouldn't go off even with a cloud of smoke around it. They only worked with a lit match placed underneath. This one works either way and I feel a lot safer now.

Reviews.Title: Double Sensors is the only way to go
Reviews.Author: R. Holden "ancientprof"
Reviews.Content: We have aded these smoke/fire alarms after recent news story about double sensor smoke detectors being far better than just single sensor types.

Reviews.Title: Reasonably priced quality item
Reviews.Author: Keith Wernimont
Reviews.Content: After purchasing a new home with outdated smoke alarms, I found these on Amazon with quality reviews and an excellent price. I have installed 4 of these throughout my home and feel confident in their ability to work as intended.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: These detect two ways which is nice.  I actually called the company to find out there recommendations for a house that does not have the smoke detectors hard wired in and this was one they recommended.

Reviews.Title: Seems good
Reviews.Author: justME "2"
Reviews.Content: They seem to do a good job. Does what it says on the Box. I like it takes AA's !!

Reviews.Title: Met my needs
Reviews.Author: Roberta Allen
Reviews.Content: I wanted to update our fire alarms with new double sensors. These were easy to install and meet our needs.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: AvidReader "AvidReader"
Reviews.Content: So far we are happy with this detector. Our old alarms that went off every time we turned on the oven or cooked a hot dog didn't go off when we had an actual fire (smoldering), which is why we replaced them with this one (or photoelectric only in other rooms) after talking with the local fire inspector.  So far no false alarms.  I hope we never have to test whether it goes off for a real fire again.

Reviews.Title: I am Comfortable
Reviews.Author: Ernest A. Burleson
Reviews.Content: I replaced a First Alert single action smoke detector with this dual action. I felt lucky that this one fit the same holes in ceiling.I tested it outside before installing and was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Love it...
Reviews.Author: Martin H. Beringer
Reviews.Content: Have installed this several moths ago and have not gotten any false alarms on it. Every other detector kept giving me false alarms. Great product.

Reviews.Title: Replacement
Reviews.Author: Timothy J Rahman
Reviews.Content: Installed easily. Replacement for smoke sensors that were over ten years old.Won't know if it works until I get another smoky fire.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive and it works.
Reviews.Author: Fred B. Holbert
Reviews.Content: Easily installed with understandable instructions for mounting locations. Purchased two -- will consider installing more units for more comprehensive coverage.

Reviews.Title: Everything needed for smoke and fire detection.
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: I wanted smoke detectors that used both ionization and photoelectric for the best warning of fires.  This item is easy to mount and replace batteries without taking the detector down.

Reviews.Title: straight forward
Reviews.Author: WJD "BD"
Reviews.Content: seems to be working well so far. easy to install the proof will be how long it lasts before you get a false alarm a issue i have had in the past

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: Richard Calvanese
Reviews.Content: first aleart sa320cn double sensor smoke and fire alarm.the main reasons for purchasing this item was price and quality.

Reviews.Title: No more 9V batteries!  Very sensitive!
Reviews.Author: Matt Upton
Reviews.Content: We are very diligent about changing batteries in our smoke detectors, but we almost always has to make a seperate trip to the hardware store to buy 9V batteries because nothing else uses that battery size anymore.  We buy AA batteries in bulk at our wholesale club so those we always have around so we find this better.  The change process is easy and fast.  We have 5 of these installed around our house now.  The performance of the alarm is more than any other units we have.  The kitchen unit does alarm very quickly if I start to burn anything on the stove or toaster.  Those extra seconds/minutes will be priceless if we ever have a real fire in the house.

Reviews.Title: Seems to do what it was advertized to do.
Reviews.Author: Ken Deking "dekss418"
Reviews.Content: After watching a demonstration of a similar smoke and fire alarm that sold for 15 times the price of this unit and being convinced we needed the dual sense type, I bought one of these to test it out. I'm impressed that it's every bit as good as that overpriced one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent smoke detector.
Reviews.Author: Thule1
Reviews.Content: Fire departments strongly recommend the dual-sensor type of detector.  I have both types in my home, but this is the first with both sensors in the same package. Detectors need to be replaced at least every 10 years. I had one that was 20 years old and still worked, but these devices are inexpensive so I now replace all of them as they age. You can't totally prevent ignition sources but getting an early warning cn help prevent needless loss. I will use this type from now on.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install
Reviews.Author: Peter D. Walchli "MKEgaffer"
Reviews.Content: I bought three of these (one for each level of our house). It took all of twenty minutes to install all of them. That being said, the two main reasons that I purchased these were the excellent specs/reviews that the detectors received and the price is fairly low for what you get.

Reviews.Title: AA  Batteries Included
Reviews.Author: Gary A. Brinkerhoff "Gary A Brinkerhoff"
Reviews.Content: First Alert SA320CN Double Sensor Battery-Powered Smoke and Fire Alarm  Product arrived on time. I followed instructions to to put on wall which i chose to install near kitchen and it works beautifully. A small sized screwdriver is all that's needed to install. To test alarm, make sure you press button all the way in or you will think it's not working,,, It does work...

Reviews.Title: Best of the dual mode smoke/fire alarms
Reviews.Author: MartinJ
Reviews.Content: Wanted this dual sensor alarm for my condo. Kiddie, the only other mainstream unit with dual sensors uses a 9 volt battery,(which are expensive), whereas this First Alert uses 2 'AA's'.  No trouble installing it where my old one was. It looks good and tests out fine. I feel good about this unit. I couldn't find it locally and Amazon had a good price and delivered it as promised. I never had a house fire, but feel this unit would offer the best protection available.  It also has all the features it should, and should give you a full 10 years of reliable operation. The alarm is plenty loud, it has a handy test button an led that blinks periodically to tell you the batteries are good and a super easy slide out battery compartment. All smoke detectors recommend replacement after 10 years. This is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: Good Smoke Detector
Reviews.Author: Nicholas J. Naylor
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a low profile smoke alarm, look elsewhere.  This is a fairly bulky unit, but still looks ok.  I'm surprised it runs on 2AA's instead of a 9V.  I've only had it a couple months, so I can't say anything on battery life.  I would recommend this smoke alarm.

Reviews.Title: Finally a smoke/fire detector happy with something besides a 9 volt battery
Reviews.Author: D. Talbot
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my dad to replace a unit having a 9 volt battery. Those batteries are becoming dinosaurs. This uniit uses good old AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: safety first
Reviews.Author: ted t
Reviews.Content: I replaced 3 old First alert smoke detectors with these since they were 10 years old.  I like the fact that they are double sensor units for added safety. I also like the fact that they use AA batteries compared to the 9 volt used in the older units.  Battery drawer pulls out but can't say if it's any easier to replace the batteries.  However, the unit does unscrew from the base so it can be removed & batteries changed from the ground instead of standing on a ladder.( hope I never need to find out how they work but have confidence in the First Alert brand)

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: BenSnookered
Reviews.Content: I really do not know how well this first alert alarm will work. This is a product I hope I never have to use. I wanted  one that had both ionization and photoelectric smoke sensors.It uses AA batteries rather than the 9 volt which I considered a plus.The price was very competitive compared to those I looked at in the big box stores.

Reviews.Title: In two years I've got through three of these.
Reviews.Author: Electrice
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I purchased our house this was the fire alarm next to the master bedroom. With in six months it started chirping and going off randomly in the middle of the night even after replacing the batteries with Energizers.(don't ask) We figure the alarm was old so bought a new one.  Ten months later the same problem. So checked several review sites, and thought perhaps we just got a defective one because many sites were saying this was the best. So we decided we would give them one more chance. It's been just under a year, but last night 3 AM... Why do they always seem to break in the middle of the night?  Anyhow, I think we're done with First Alert, and am going to give Kidde a try.

Reviews.Title: rractical testing results
Reviews.Author: David S. James "Always remember you are uniqu...
Reviews.Content: REASON FOR BUYING: I used to leave my PC turn on whole night. Since it is not designed to work 24 hours nobody know what may happen while I am sleeping. I treat my life more than 20 USD, that's why I decided to buy this fire alarm.EXTERIOR: When you open a box you will definitely notice that product is done from high quality materials. I am absolutely sure nobody wants to trust their life to some cheap Chinese copy that why I paid attention how good small parts are done and well fitted.SENSITIVITY: In the instruction it was strongly recommended not to test it with real fire or smoke but I am not that kind of person who will fallow all stupid instruction. How can I trust device which I personally did not test in real life? :D So I installed the alarm and set peace of paper on fire...1) I was expecting that photo element will notice the flames and start alarm but nothing happened during 30 seconds. The fire was located just 30-40 centimeters away from alarm. The first idea which came to my mind: wtf, does it need half of my root to be on fire for activating alarm? That's not what I was expecting...2) Then I tried to place flaming paper in that way, so the smoke will hit the alarm and in 5 sec I headed long-awaited sound of alarm :)Right now I have a doubt: may be the photo element require dark room to detect flames? Once I will have some more free time, I will defiantly make this kind of test and update my review. Right now as a conclusion - the device have good sensitivity for smoke detection but very bad for flame.SOUND LEVEL: The sound is very loud. You can easily get become deaf if you will stay one meter away from this alarm for a long time.INSTALLATION: The installation of alarm is easy. Instead of using screws I personally used double sided sticky tape, which glued to the wall tightly (later when I decided to move alarm a bit higher, I cannot unmount holder from the wall)FALSE ALARM: It is not much time since I installed it, so I can say nothing about amount of false alarms (I do not have any) but it was written that you can easily fix that by cleaning it with regular vacuum cleaner (once per month).

Reviews.Title: Not a valid replacement for the sa302
Reviews.Author: boter_99 "boter_99"
Reviews.Content: When I bought my house 7 years ago, I smoke detectored every bedroom with the sa302cn models. The Ir remote trigger allowed for easy testing on my high ceilings, and the loud clear alarm never failed to awake (as in the winter occasionally a high setting on our humidifier would trigger a false alarm).Having a recent unit failure I picked up two of these sa320's when informed they were the newer version of the 302. Out of the box I new something was wrong when upon inserting the batteries the alarm that sounded was meek and static filled, more of a "um excuse me?" rather than "HEY FIRE!". Thinking it was a faulty unit I opened the other package to find the same result. Comparing batch numbers I saw they had completely different expiration dates.  Then I tried mounting it on the old already installed brackets - no luck. Perhaps the screw holes would match? no. Off by just enough that I had to re-drill, anchor and screw in the new mounting bracket. It was only then - much to my dismay - that I noticed there was no IR test function.Over all a poor cheap substitute that has me looking for a new brand of smoke alarm.

Reviews.Title: Not recomended.see below
Reviews.Author: ted
Reviews.Content: Put up 2 weeks on ceiling .Had fire in microwave oven.S D was 6 ft from smoke and fire. Never went off.Tested 3 days before.I was20 feet past the s d .I smelled and light haze I could see. Put out fire. Called 1st alert sent another one.Sent back bad unit.Push the button and blow smoke in unit it works.We,ll see how it works.??????

Reviews.Title: Bought it for a feature its instruction book never mentions!
Reviews.Author: L. Kelly
Reviews.Content: NAMELY:"Remote Mute and Easy Battery Access for Safety and ConvenienceTo mute unnecessary alarms instantly, you can simply point almost any household remote control at the detector and click mute--whether the remote is for your TV, stereo, DVD player, or another appliance. The convenience of this feature means that something as simple as burnt toast never tempts you to take the battery out of your smoke detector and create an unsafe situation in your home. The mute button can also be used to test the alarm function, helping you ensure that your home and family are always protected"NOWHERE IS THIS EVEN MENTIONED IN THE INSTRUCTIONS THAT CAME IN THE PACKAGE!

Reviews.Title: Poor workmanship
Reviews.Author: Renny
Reviews.Content: Everything looks fine except when I pressed the test button, the alarm sounded only half of the time.  I couldn't tell if it is the case of faulty test button or faulty detector.  I didn't bother to return it.  This is the case of poor workmanship for making things off-shore. What happened to the good old American made quality!!!

Reviews.Title: Dual protection beats more "advanced" detectors.
Reviews.Author: foozman
Reviews.Content: Has both types of detectors: photoelectric and ionization. Beware of fancy detectors without ionization. 4 stars because one failed in one month, but gets 4 because it alerted the failure with a chirp. New battery did not help.May not meet building standards. For example, in 2018, Maryland will require a sealed battery or hard wire. I'll update then. I wish they would also require dual detection. I challenge anyone to find a dual detection sealed battery detector.

Reviews.Title: Smoke and Fire Alarm
Reviews.Author: JMB "jb"
Reviews.Content: Our smoke alarms for over ten years old and we bought the double sensor pursuant to a fireman's recommendation.  We had two defective smoke alarms, but they were exchanged with no issue.

Reviews.Title: About this product:
Reviews.Author: Shirl
Reviews.Content: This product is as described.  Everything about this product has lived up to my expectations so far, both in craftsmanship and durability.

Reviews.Title: Seemed fine
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I specifically wanted dual smoke alarm for bedroom and living area. (These are not for kitchens). O ordered 4. They all worked fine out of the box. They are a little high (Maybe 3"), but I have them on the ceiling and they do not bother me. I need a smoke alarm to be reliable and work correctly when needed. Aesthetics are irrelevant.No issue with these and the price was fine with no shipping cost.I deducted 1 star not because of any issue but because these are brand new and time will tell if they fail. I have had many alarms of various makes over many years and none have so I am perfectly satisfied.People who complain about false alarms are using the wrong type in the wrong place. Do some research and figure out what you need first.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: G Wayne Ollis
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this product.  Only had it one day and to be honest I've not purchased a detector in many years so pretty old technology is my baseline.  I love how it is designed to be able to replace the batteries without taking it down from the ceiling.  That is a huge advantage to me.  Another huge plus is the use of AA batteries.  The only thing in my home that uses 9V are the smoke detectors we have so I always have to buy those when I need to replace the batteries in my old ones, not so with this one as I almost always have AA's around.  I've not tested it and hope I don't have to officially.

Reviews.Title: started beeping - broke after 13 months
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Seemed to work fine, but started beeping a 1 AM every 10 seconds a couple weeks back. (bought this in Feb 2013) Put new batteries in at 1 am (yawnnnn) still kept beeping every 10 seconds. read on the unit this can happen after 7 years, (try 14 months) I believe it's a sensor malfunction. I'm glad that it let me know, but very annoying when it happened and more annoying that it happened so soon!

Reviews.Title: Nice unit
Reviews.Author: Robert McDonough
Reviews.Content: It installed easily and seems sturdy. The price was very reasonable. I hope it lasts a long time.  Overall i'm satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Easy to  use
Reviews.Author: Beaumont Jedi "BmtJedi"
Reviews.Content: I like how easy these are to use. The way the batteries are mounted, just slide them in and the device is ready to go. The instructions are on one huge sheet of paper that is a little complicated to navigate through - but not difficult. I rated this item a four because the instructions imply that the LED should blink green occasionally when the device is running. I bought two of these and the test works, but the LED does not blink during normal operations. Makes for a little nervousness. Maybe I should test?

Reviews.Title: First Alert SA320CN Double Sensor Battery-Powered Smoke and Fire Alarm
Reviews.Author: Dan Zhang
Reviews.Content: This is my second fire alarm of this model, it works so far so good. I wish it works as it designed. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install
Reviews.Author: JohnE
Reviews.Content: I think it would wake us up in case of fire/smoke...hope I never need to find out for sure. Reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: Not loud enough
Reviews.Author: Rain Man
Reviews.Content: If you have this in a hallway or something open like that then I think it's OK, But if you are going to have it in a room with a closed door you can't hear it from two rooms away. Also the sound is NOT annoying or alarming, so if there are other noises it's very easy that you don't really notice that there is something wrong. I had a guest who didn't know we installed it, and we were testing, it kept beeping for a long time, when we ask him, he said he thought it was somebody's phone or something.

Reviews.Title: Ok, so far.
Reviews.Author: verizon girl
Reviews.Content: Only been installed for a month.  No problems so far.  I like that AA batteries are used. Cheaper than 9volts.

Reviews.Title: Great choice.
Reviews.Author: Aleks
Reviews.Content: I bought this dual sensor smoke/fire alarm along with a separate CO monitor. Best protection and combination in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Very simple
Reviews.Author: 49erfrank
Reviews.Content: All i had to do was activate the batteries. Hope i never have to use it but am gald that i have it.

Reviews.Title: Where There's Smoke, There's Fire...Maybe
Reviews.Author: sc
Reviews.Content: We're very pleased with this choice. It has both the visual and thermal sensors, and it appears that that combination really reduces the terribly annoying false alarms that you normally get from steam or smoke in the kitchen. It's unobtrusive in appearance and easy to mount.

Reviews.Title: Haven't had to use it, knock on wood.
Reviews.Author: W. Loo
Reviews.Content: I don't know how well it works to detect smoke but I know it will trigger in high humidity. I use a ultrasonic humidifier in my room and if it's set too high, it will eventually set the alarm off.

Reviews.Title: 8 months?  Really?
Reviews.Author: ECJ "ericcjack"
Reviews.Content: Junk...after only 8 months.  I've changed the batteries 2 times and it still goes into alarm mode.  J U N K!

Reviews.Title: Easy installation
Reviews.Author: Linda B Muncy
Reviews.Content: It was easy to install. Liked that it was a dual sensor. Easy battery replacement. Using it in a hallway.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: SheriffJoe
Reviews.Content: I consider the quality very good for this item. It is so sensitive to it's environment it went off when I painted the wall around it. For a alarm it is loud, clear and crisp and the price can't be beat. And so sensitive drying paint will cause it to go off. I am serious.

Reviews.Title: Detects Both Types of Fires Quickly
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Unlike most smoke detectors this includes not only photoelectric detection but also ionization detection. This means it will react much, much faster to a fast flaming fire than other detectors, which are only particularly sensitive to slow, smoldering fires.

Reviews.Title: Dual Sensor Detector at a Good Price
Reviews.Author: Christopher Scheld
Reviews.Content: This First Alert detector is easy to use and has the advantage of detecting both smoke and fire. The alarm, as expected, is very loud and would work well in either a house or smaller apartment. I have not had any issues with the product after 6 months of use. For $20, it's tough to find a dual sensor detector of this quality.

Reviews.Title: Good features, has some quirks
Reviews.Author: Walter R. Francis
Reviews.Content: I haven't yet tested it in real life yet, lets hope I never have to.  The features are good on this smoke detector, however, it has a common quirk that I've found here and other sites...  I have a small (1050 sqft) single-floor house, so this is located centrally in the house, between kitchen, bedrooms, and near the main bath.  When I'm showering the detector will start doing three quick chirps.  It doesn't do it every day, and it almost always stops within a minute or two after the shower is off.  However, two different days it kept going for 20+ minutes after the shower and I eventually had to get up and take the batteries out, then I put them back in and it was fine.So water vapor sets it off?  That's fair, as long as that's a design to catch smoke and carbon emissions from fire etc.  But having to get out a chair and get up and reset it is annoying.

Reviews.Title: Smoke detector
Reviews.Author: Newbie
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item to replace a worn out older smoke detector. It seems to be of good quality and works great.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: planetmike
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive, easy to install and passed all the test modes. Don't bother using the AA alkaline batteries. For added security and longevity, use AA lithium batteries.

Reviews.Title: working great
Reviews.Author: gammyd
Reviews.Content: Like the first one so well I bought another one. Very please with them. I have always bought First Alert

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and work great
Reviews.Author: Alex M.
Reviews.Content: I wanted to make sure that I had the best protection so I looked up what was most recommended and everywhere I looked it said to get the dual sensor. It measures two different signs of fire/smoke and will alert you. Even if you don't see any smoke it will tell you that your pan is too hot on the stove! I got distracted and left a pan of butter heating up and it burnt up but didn't smoke up the place and the alarm still went off. It IS kind of sensitive but I would rather have one go off all the time than not go off when i need it!

Reviews.Title: Beep!
Reviews.Author: Austin Haynes "Sinitron"
Reviews.Content: Haven't had a fire, thankfully, but the mounting and testing worked well. Instructions were clear and helpful about the correct places to mount a detector.

Reviews.Title: I think its doing it's job but......
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: It goes of randomly for no reason at all every couple weeks I'm guessing just a test at least I know it works or the batteries are still good..

Reviews.Title: Seems ok
Reviews.Author: LJ
Reviews.Content: I liked the fact that the unit is a double sensor model.  It installed easily and I have had no problems with it.However,  the light is so tiny that it cannot be seen.  So unless the unit sounds the alarm or I stand on a ladderto test it,  I cannot really tell what the light might be indicating.
